#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Tambolaka
#Text=Tambolaka is a growing town in Sumba , Indonesia , used as the western entry point for the island .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Tambolaka used to be just a small area where the airport is , and Waitabula is ( sometime written as " Weetabula " , and originally " Wetobula " ) .
#Text=Now Tambolaka has grown into a city district that includes Waitabula as its sub-district .
#Text=Travelers normally use Tambolaka as the base to explore West Sumba , despite the stretch of distance to the tourist spots , due to limited accommodations .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Tambolaka Airport ( TMC ) .
#Text=Handles flights mostly from/to Denpasar and Kupang .
#Text=There are about 20 direct flights per week from Denpasar .
#Text=If you are coming from Flores , you can fly in from Ende with Wings Air .
#Text=Ticket is around IDR 800,000 ( as of Nov 2018 )
#Text=By boat
#Text=There are several ferry route to Tambolaka from Flores with ASDP Indonesia Ferry services .
#Text=Check the routes and prices in ASDP website .
#Text=Price is usually around IDR 80,000 - IDR 100,000 ( as of Nov 2018 ) .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Transportation is expensive in Sumba due to the limited availability of vehicles for tourism .
#Text=In general you can expect ( as of Dec 2018 ) :
#Text=Motorbike rental for a day : IDR 100,000 - IDR 150,000
#Text=Car rental ( with driver ) for a day : IDR 500,000 - IDR 700,000
#Text=There is no taxi operator in Sumba , but there are independent drivers touting at the airport .
#Text=As in any developing destinations , you would need to get a clear rate ( per person or per location ) , repeat it , and pay them exactly ( do n't use the IDR 100,000 note ) .
#Text=The rate from the airport to downtown Tambolaka is IDR 50,000 per trip ( as of Nov 2018 ) .
#Text=You would be surprised to know that these drivers would rather get an extra IDR 50,000 immediately by cheating you , rather than scoring IDR 600,000 for a day trip the following day .
#Text=Get your accommodation to pick you up if possible .
#Text=Your accommodation would be able to recommend drivers with good track records if you need a day trip .
#Text=See
#Text=Two of the tourism highlights in West Sumba are beaches and traditional villages , although they are sometime 30km away from Tambolaka .
#Text=There is no ticketing or fixed price in Sumba ( remember , infrastructure and system for tourism is still developing here ) .
#Text=Most of the places would require you to sign a guest book and donate a voluntary amount .
#Text=The recommended amount is IDR 20,000 per person ( as of Dec 2018 ) .
#Text=Sumba Cultural Center ( Rumah Budaya Sumba ) .
#Text=Run by a Catholic missionary to promote Sumba culture .
#Text=If you intend to visit the traditional villages , it is highly recommended to visit the this Center first .
#Text=The fee for the guide is voluntary .
#Text=At the end of the tour , you will be asked to sign the guest book and give your donation .
#Text=Recommended IDR 50,000 per person , or refer to the amount that the previous guests donated for reference .
#Text=Ratenggaro Village : probably the most famous ( and most visited ) village in Sumba .
#Text=As a consequence , some of the residents become really materialistic .
#Text=Note the fee on the small board near the entrance .
#Text=Ratenggaro Beach : Located just about 200 m from Ratenggaro Village , this is the original site of Ratenggaro Village before it relocated to the current site .
#Text=You can find some megalithic tombs here , including one of the previous village chief 's .
#Text=Entrance fee is fixed at IDR 20,000 per motorbike and IDR 50,000 per car ( as of Dec 2018 ) .
#Text=Wainyapu Village and Wainyapu Beach : on the other side of the river of Ratenggaro Village
#Text=Bawana Beach and Watu Malandong Beach : See the unique rock karst rock formation next to the sea .
#Text=Mandorak Beach : A small beach with a small opening between two rocks .
#Text=Local fishermen are coming/going from the beach to do their fishing .
#Text=Voluntary donation , pay at the entrance / gate .
#Text=Weekuri Lake : located nearby Mandorak Beach , you would see a saltwater lake that is connected to the sea .
#Text=You can jump into the lake to cool down .
#Text=There are toilet to change and some handicraft sellers .
#Text=Recommended entrance fee for IDR 20,000 per person ( as of Dec 2018 ) .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Tambolaka / Waitabula Market :
#Text=Typical market you can find groceries and daily needs .
#Text=It is quite big to walk on and the locals are quite friendly .
#Text=Drink
#Text=You can get cold beer from kiosks on the street side for IDR 35,000 per big bottle .
#Text=Only Bintang is available in Sumba , locals have information that Bintang has blocked the access of other beer brands in the island .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Rumah Budaya Sumba : yes the cultural center is also running an accommodation business , about IDR 500,000 per night ( as of Nov 2018 )
#Text=Hotel Sinar Tambolaka .
#Text=a large local hotel IDR 250,000 per night ( as of Nov 2018 )
#Text=Renata Homestay , IDR 200,000 per night ( as of Nov 2018 )
#Text=Melati Homestay , IDR 250,000 per night ( as of Nov 2018 )
#Text=Connect
#Text=Telkomsel is recommended here .
#Text=You may get phone signals with other phone operators , but the chance of getting internet is very slim ( as of Dec 2018 ) .
#Text=Go next
#Text=To Waikabubak , from morning until 4pm .
#Text=60-90 minutes away , another good base to explore West Sumba .
#Text=The bus terminal is located near the Tambolaka Market , but you can also wait on the road side as they will pick up passengers along the way .
#Text=They will depart to destination after it is full .
